pli-tv-pvr2.9:0.4.eng: Questions and answers on the nuns’ Pātimokkha rules and their analysis

pli-tv-pvr2.9:1.0.eng: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-pvr2.9:1.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:1.1.eng: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of consenting to physical contact was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.1.eng: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of consenting to physical contact was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.6.pli: Sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.6.eng: The lustful nun Sundarīnandā consenting to a lustful man making physical contact with her.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.9.eng: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.16.eng: “In which of the four ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.23.eng: The class of offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.26.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe…
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.26.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr2.9:3.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing expulsion that is a result of concealing an offense. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodesi na gaṇassa ārocesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā, knowing that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, neither confronting her herself nor telling the community.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.9.comm: There is an inconsistency here. According to the parallel passage at Pvr 2.1:19.9 this should read kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, “from body, speech, and mind”.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.1.pli: Yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing expulsion that is a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ anuvatti, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā taking sides with the monk Ariṭṭha, an ex-vulture-killer, who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.1.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ vatthuṃ paripūraṇapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing expulsion that is a result of fulfilling the eight parts. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo aṭṭhamaṃ vatthuṃ paripūresuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six fulfilling the eight parts.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.10.eng: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:9.0.eng: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension, etc.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:9.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena ussayavādikāya bhikkhuniyā aḍḍaṃ karaṇapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññatto?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:9.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of a litigious nun initiating a lawsuit was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena ussayavādikāya bhikkhuniyā aḍḍaṃ karaṇapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of a litigious nun initiating a lawsuit was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī ussayavādikā vihari, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā taking legal action.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.9.eng: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.16.eng: “In which of the four ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.23.eng: The class of offenses entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.26.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.26.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.27.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe…

pli-tv-pvr2.9:11.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:13.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr2.9:13.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr2.9:13.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr2.9:13.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of giving the full admission to a female criminal. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī coriṃ vuṭṭhāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā giving the full admission to a female criminal.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.9.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.9.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.1.pli: Ekā gāmantaraṃ gamanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of walking to the next inhabited area by oneself. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī ekā gāmantaraṃ gacchi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.6.eng: A certain nun walking to the next village by herself.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.7.eng: There is one rule. There are three additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.9:16.1.pli: Samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāraṇapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:16.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of readmitting a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:16.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāresi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:16.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā readmitting a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:16.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:17.1.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:17.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of a lustful nun eating fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:17.6.pli: Sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato āmisaṃ paṭiggahesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:17.6.eng: The nun Sundarīnandā, being lustful, receiving food directly from a lustful man.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:17.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:17.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.1.pli: “Kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā. Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti uyyojanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of urging a nun on, saying, ‘Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you.’ Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī—“kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā. Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti uyyojesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.6.eng: A certain nun urging a nun on, saying, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you.”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.9:19.1.pli: Kupitāya anattamanāya bhikkhuniyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:19.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of an angry nun not stopping when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:19.6.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ avaca—“buddhaṃ paccācikkhāmi, dhammaṃ paccācikkhāmi, saṅghaṃ paccācikkhāmi, sikkhaṃ paccācikkhāmī”ti, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:19.6.eng: The nun Caṇḍakālī saying in anger, “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:19.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:20.1.pli: Kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatāya bhikkhuniyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:20.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of a nun who has lost a legal case not stopping when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:20.6.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ avaca—“chandagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, dosagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, mohagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, bhayagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo”ti, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:20.6.eng: The nun Caṇḍakālī, who had lost a legal case, saying in anger, “The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:20.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:21.1.pli: Saṃsaṭṭhānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:21.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of socializing nuns not stopping when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:21.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo saṃsaṭṭhā vihariṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:21.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:22.1.pli: “Saṃsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha. Mā tumhe nānā viharitthā”ti uyyojentiyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:22.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of urging nuns on in this way: ‘Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately,’ and then not stopping when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:22.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī—“saṃsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha. Mā tumhe nānā viharitthā”ti uyyojesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:22.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā urging the nuns on, saying, “Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately.”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:22.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā pāṭidesanīyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing acknowledgment that is a result of asking for curd and then eating it. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six asking for curd and then eating it.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in four ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.9.eng: The questions and answers on the nuns’ Pātimokkha rules and their analysis, the first, are finished.
